website_summaries.verdict: If you can overlook a few small drawbacks, the MDR-1000X is a top-notch wireless noise-canceling headphone that's stacked with features and sounds excellent.
pros: The Sony MDR-1000X is an excellent-sounding, comfortable wireless headphone with effective noise-canceling that measures up to Bose's for muffling ambient noise
It has good battery life and some nifty extra features geared toward frequent travelers
cons: its adaptive noise-canceling is too noticeable at times

customer_reviews.title: Warranty issues
customer_reviews.text: The plastic component connecting the headband to the sides fell off from normal use. Sony refuses to RMA or fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor construction.
customer_reviews.text: They were really wonderful until the headband cracked on both sides right above the ear cups. After only 5 months. For this price, they should be much more robust. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The headphone worked awesome for about 3 months before the headband plastic on ...
customer_reviews.text: The headphone worked awesome for about 3 months before the headband plastic on both sides cracked, I thought it was only a minor cosmetic issue, but today (about 6 months after i purchased them) the earcup on both sides fully separated from the headband. This is a defective product. I'm stuck hoping that Sony will do a warranty repair that addresses whatever defective design/material has made these fail.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cracking Headband
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for 3 months, the headband cracked from regular use. I checked online, this problem appears to be happening to many of them. The sound quality and NC is great, but the crucial pivot points and headband are all plastic. For the price, this should not be happening. Stick with the BoseQC35.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A DiPenice

customer_reviews.title: Cracked hinge and terrible warranty return service
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work great and block out quite a bit of background noise. Had to have these replaced after 6 months of use because the hinge where the cups connect to the head band began to crack. Although I can get these replaced under warranty, the return services provided by Sony is frustrating and slow. You would expect headphones in this price range to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Yang

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Defect with the Headband has been causing the units to break down after a few weeks or months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May, and I started getting cracks in the headband, like others have reported in just a month. While these are a great headset for sound. It will not last long. Sony has agreed to replace the units that broke down, but my worry is that it will happen again in the near future, and after an year it will no longer be eligible for a warranty. Beyond which, I will have to buy something else. When I pay 400 dollars for a pair of headphones, I expect them to last atleast 2 years. Obviously if it does break down another time, I will not be buying Sony again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your headband will break and Sony's response will create more Bose customers.
customer_reviews.text: This product has a fatal design flaw that means your headband will crack all the way through just above the earcup rotation hinge. This should have triggered a recall but Sony has decided to not make their customers whole. See the customer pictures of the cracked band. Not a rare occurrence. If you are lucky enough to have the breakage happen in a warranty period you may get another one (that will break). If not.. you are now a Bose customer. So much for Sony's triumphant return. Don't buy. Given shoddy customer experience .. don't buy the new version either IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Slim

customer_reviews.title: cheap materials, cracked plastic, poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great, Bluetooth works fine, and the battery life is pretty good, however the physical quality is sub-par. The cheap plastic band near the hinge is completely cracked on both sides, and offers no structural support at all causing the headset to sit askew on my head making it uncomfortable and unbalance. The plastic is crumbling and obviously just cheaply made. These may sound like premium headphones but they were poorly designed and used cheap materials. Would not recommend. Sony has also refused to replace them, I will never buy another sony product again.
customer_reviews.author: McEwen

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing. Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: OMG. These are amazing. Great comfort, absolutely concert hall sound--I only listen to classical--and awesome easy controls. And end to the noise pollution of a walk in the city. Easy bluetooth pairing. They come with a hard case for travel. I don't know how I lived without them. The noise canceling is easily as good as the Bose equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. RJ

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a present for myself. I use it during travel and to wind down with music. Noise canceling is awesome. I accidentally found the calibration function. I'm sure in a controlled environment you can hear the difference but with or without calibration this headset sounds amazing. I've fallen asleep with them on because they are very comfortable. I haven't used them with my phone to answer calls but the Bluetooth connection is immediate with my tablet. I bought it at the manufacturer's retail price and have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken headband in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I really love the sound quality of these headphones and the noise cancellation is amazing. However, the build quality is terrible. I have treated these headphones very gently but the headband broke at the hinge. I don't think I can get a replacement now since I tried glueing them back together with some white epoxy but even that failed. I have a really old pair of $20 headphones that I have thrown around but still look great. Why on Earth should a $400 pair of headphones break in less than 6 months! Avoid these headphones at all cost!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: The best noise cancelling over ear headphones on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They fit well covering my whole ear... can wear them on a 10hr flight no problem. Ambient sound voice mode allows me to cancel out dull background noise like that on a plane but still carry on conversations. Full noise cancelling mode works so well I can sleep during takeoff and landing! Sound quality is tops too... I'm hearing subtle parts of music I've listened to for years that I've never heard or noticed in the past.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Build Quality for $500 Cans
customer_reviews.text: The headband cracking issue that a lot of the other users have seen just happened to me as well. Its been less than 6 months since I bought these and Sony customer services said buying extra warranty would've covered this damage. The sound quality and noise-cancellation was great but the build quality is terrible. I bought them solely for use in office and always keep them inside cover, they broke today when I was taking them off.
customer_reviews.author: AOS4

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Other people will write more detailed reviews of this product but here's some straightforward info. Pros: - Great fit. - Easy controls. - Battery charge is excellent. - Flat sound. No bass boost on these headphones. You're buying these so that there is not factory built in sound shaping. It may take some getting used to, but end the end you'll learn to appreciate your favorite music more without head rattling bass. Cons: - If you're going to need to used these wired (ever even once) you will need to order the 3.5mm jack that is made for this headphones. Almost all other 3.5mm connectors will be too wide for the input hole which is inset for some crazy reason.
customer_reviews.author: Bevrocktagon

customer_reviews.title: A big step for wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: Never expected myself to transform my over 10 years IEM fanboy to a everday over-ear headphone user. This one did. For a wireless headphones, it sounds perfect. For a noise-cancelling device, it excels. For a bluetooth headphones, well,the bluetooth chip inside this headphone is excellent but your bluetooth device also needs a great bluetooth chip in order to work properly. Do I recommend it? As a New Yorker who rides subway everyday, definitely yes. This will extend your eardrum lifespan. Do I look dorky for wearing this? Less dorky than Bose headphones, but who cares. You are in your own music festival with any headphones on anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound quality compared to Bose
customer_reviews.text: Much better sound quality compared to Bose, especially the lower ranges (although, i know the argument on sound quality a pretty much a personal preference one). Good for use at home, tried them in short flight once, I have to say the noise cancelling ability is not as good as Bose QC series (i have a QC25 and QC20 which is the best noise cancelling in flight headphone in my opinion).
customer_reviews.author: Jing

customer_reviews.title: I have loved these headphones for a year but now at the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have loved these headphones for a year but now at the 14 month mark they have developed an intermittent crackling in the right ear. This is unacceptable for a 400$ pair of headphones. Of course they're out of warranty so I'm SOL. My sister has the bose units and they've been fine for years. I bought the sony pair for sound but now I can't even use them because it's so annoying. buyer beware, there are issues with all of the models of these with crackling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality that holds up with convenient noise-canceling modes
customer_reviews.text: These are the greatest headphones I've ever owned. I've had them a little over 2 years, and you wouldn't know it by looking at them. They look the same as they did on day one, and the sound quality is just as fantastic. I work as a developer in a room with 3 other people. There are times when I need to cut out the outside world and get things done, and for that the noise-canceling feature works phenomenally well. Other times, I need to be available for discussions but still like to listen to music; for that, I can turn on "ambient" mode and catch any conversations that take place. Hopefully these things last me many more years.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to convince myself to spend this much money on headphones, but it is truly one of the best purchases I've made in a long time. The sound quality is exceptional, and the noise canceling is also top-notch. All the pro reviews seem to agree that the Bose pairs have slightly better noise canceling while the Sony pairs have slightly better sound quality. These headphones have made long flights much more enjoyable, and double as hearing protection with music when mowing the lawn or leaf blowing. My only regret is that I didn't buy them sooner!
customer_reviews.author: M. Finnance

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is flawed
customer_reviews.text: Out of the 4 versions of this product this was the best. Unfortunately mine froze during a firmware upgrade, 100% battery, through the Sony app. Don't decided to upgrade me to the WH-1000XM2, they suck! The noise cancellation during a phone call is non-existent, the person on the other side of the call can hear everything surrounding me. Every noise is heard and it baffles me as the noise cancellation during entertainment use is the best!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana J

customer_reviews.title: Cause ear pain that lasted a long time
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these headphones for sound quality and noise cancelation BUT they are heavy and fit poorly. Beyond that they also caused me serious outer ear canal pain that took a year to get better. I don’t know if it was the fit or the Bluetooth radiation but I went back to wired headphones. Beyond that, the headphones are MUCH less comfortable than the Bose headphones which are the same price. The interface is also clunky. Some ok features but these went obsolete quickly. Move on.
customer_reviews.author: DGK

customer_reviews.title: I love them.
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones and amazing fit. I can wear these for 4-5 hours straight without discomfort. Much more comfortable than my girlfriend’s Beats studio wireless 2 headphones. For reference, I think I wear a 7 5/8 fitted cap. Noise canceling was a godsend on a couple 3 hour flights a few weeks ago. I love them for work so I can block everyone out but hold my hand to my ear if I need to hear a quick question or instruction. Not so quiet I can’t hear the secretary page my phone. I’m not really about them breaking as I’m extra careful and don’t need to stretch them far to fit on my head, and I’ve had no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brocko

customer_reviews.title: They sound good when plugged in with an audio cable
customer_reviews.text: They sound good when plugged in with an audio cable. Using bluetooth, the sound has a lot of compression artifacts, such as static, clicks, and pops. It really struggles with bluetooth sound quality when playing full, dense audio that has a lot of instruments. The sound over bluetooth is a bit better than FM quality, in my opinion. Comfort is not perfect, but it's adequate. The noise-canceling is effective, and the buttons and touch features of the headphones are pretty well thought out and useful.
customer_reviews.author: beaf

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate noise cancellation and premium feel
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation works like magic. Sound quality is clean and superb. It has user-friendly functionalities such as turning off noise cancellation, recalibrate the noise cancellation when you enter a different area with a different kind of noise (I think this should have been made automatic though. May be it is but I don't notice). It feels premium.
customer_reviews.author: Chibuzo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality earphones
customer_reviews.text: Top rated for a reason. They perform very well. Comfortable. Excellent features. Could not be more pleased. Noise cancellation works well. Allows me to hear the tv while my wife has her two-hour conversations with her mother. Was hesitant to purchase because of reviews expressing breakage issues. No issues for me, but I’m very careful when folding them for placement in the storage case. Also careful not to spread them too wide when placing on my head. Without having read their reviews I probably wouldn’t be as careful as I am. So, thanks to them for the heads up.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Roden

customer_reviews.title: -Awesome noise cancelling -Adaptive noise cancelling works really well and is extremely easy to set-up
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Awesome noise cancelling -Adaptive noise cancelling works really well and is extremely easy to set-up, you basically hold a button for some seconds -The headphone feels pretty sturdy and looks great Cons: -I own other old fashion headphones like the Audio‐Technica ATH‐M50x, wired and no noise cancelling. I can tell you there is no comparison in terms of sound quality, the Audio-Technica is far superior. So I wish there was a headphone out there that combines both awesome audio quality and noise cancelling. That being said, many reviewers consider this headphone better in sound quality than the Bose quiet comfort 35.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones with excellent noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones with excellent noise cancelling. They fit a little tighter than the Bose QC 35 and aren't as comfortable, but sound much better.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend to anyone with kids and/or a wife
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend to anyone with kids and/or a wife. You will still be able to watch as they break everything you own but at least you won't get a headache from the screaming.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Best purchased for earphones
customer_reviews.text: Got it during Black Friday 2017. Best purchased for earphones. I wore it during international flight, god~ It saved my sleeping problem. I didn't ever hear a baby crying. And it has a cable that can make you use it on computer without wasting the battery. Blue tooth works very well so far. AND PLZ, FOR GIRLS WITH EARRINGS, you need this. I wanted to get Bose QC 35 actually at the beginning, but I tried it in Bestbuy. It hurt my ears when I had my ear rings on. Then I tried this one, it perfectly covered my ears without even touching my ear rings. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, better than Bose QC35 for the entire spectrum bass to treb. Noise cancellation does its job astonishingly well totally comparable to Bose. You can choose to keep you ambient sound on or simply deactivate the noise canceling feature which Bose does not allow. The touchpad can be improved but after few tries, you get the hang of it. Not too sure about the quality of the materials. The battery lasts very long and the Bluetooth connection has a very big range of operation. Still not cheap, but totally recommended for the price considering the other "rivals".
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Pellegri

customer_reviews.title: The sound is very good, but the noise cancellation is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the Sennheiser RS 185 I recently purchased started to drop out of connection frequently. All I can say is Wow! The sound is very good, but the noise cancellation is excellent. The first time I put them on I was stunned when went from a loud room to absolute silence. I couldn't believe they were that good. After several days use I can verify the battery charge lasts at the very least 12 hours and it only seems to take about 3 hours to charge to 100%. I have had no issues with static or dropping out. The controls took a bit of getting use to, but work great.
customer_reviews.author: d. lynch

customer_reviews.title: Terrific practical daily driver headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. They always sound great; there's no "amp mode" that needs to be engaged like with Bose. A cable's included that sounds even better. They're decently light, look great, and the tech functionality is sooo convenient. Noise-cancelling is very good, and their design is very well-thought-out. I use them for at least a couple hours every day at work, and they do tend to cramp a little bit after so long, but a quick adjustment keeps me listening. Definitely worth it. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: therefore I would not recommend this product to anyone looking for a nice pair ...
customer_reviews.text: The headband on mine cracked after approximately 7 months of use (if it wasn't sitting safely on my average sized head, it's always cased), similar to what many other reviewers have already mentioned. There's no warranty coverage for this design/material defect, therefore I would not recommend this product to anyone looking for a nice pair of headphones. In this case -- no pun intended -- there's no need to even consider getting this headphone for the sound quality when it will most likely break just from being in contact with my ears. For 7 months, I was honestly quite proud of this product, but do be warned that the potential creative use of super glue is imminent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This therefore is better for your ears
customer_reviews.text: The Sony MDR-1000x headphones are definitely an ear saver when used on the plane and in server rooms. It cuts the ambient noise volume down significantly so you don't have to turn up the volume of your music to compensate for the noise. This therefore is better for your ears. The sound quality on these, in my opinon, are better than the Bose QC35 I borrowed to try from a friend. However, the MDR-1000x does seem a bit bass light. If you are looking for heavy boomy bass these are not for you, but in terms of accurate bass they do great. The headphones were quite comfortable for my various 8 hour plane rides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headband cracks after one week of light use
customer_reviews.text: Within the first week of use the headband cracked on both sides. Note the picture of the left side. That happened after week one of light use on both the left and right side. And after a few months the right side completely snapped, as shown in the other picture. The sound quality is great, but for a high end headphone and price the headband should last more than a week. And more than one year. I highly discourage anyone to purchase this product. Note it comes with a hard case to store the headphones and I used the entire time!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the dreaded crack at the hinge.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome to listen to. They have excellent noise canceling and the listening quality is outstanding. I give only 3 stars because Problem is after some time they suffer the fate of cracking at the hinge on either left or right or in my case both. Had to buy replacement parts for the broken bits though.
customer_reviews.author: Dayvie

customer_reviews.title: Better than the bose .. but you should buy bose headphones !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these one for me and a gift for my friend .. mine started cracking on the right side and my friends right side sensors stopped working .. great sound great comfort but bad bad bad construction and sony won't even care so stick with the bose for better build quality and customer service !!
customer_reviews.author: yousif

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for an overseas trip, to be able to sleep on the plane (hopefully). After charging, and the clear directions, I was listening to music when I wanted to, and when I turned on the noise canceling to sleep, they worked great. Reduced the noise greatly, and the options for when the attendant comes by so you can hear and speak is just a wave of your fingers over the outer touch adjustments. Sitting in KSA now using them to listen to some music and tune out the noise outside. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Headphone is suseptible to breakage.
customer_reviews.text: Structural integrity on the plastic was an issue I heard about. I found out how easily the plastics break when I put the headphone in my bag for the first time without a case. The plastic broke completely. And the headphone is now useless. Out of warranty, I think I'll pick up another pair and pay attention to the quality of the material a lot more than before. Durability issues make this Sony MDR model a bad buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st gen sony product
customer_reviews.text: These are 1st-gen sony product, they do sound great, extremely comfortable padding around the ear-cuffs, the build quality is premium sony, comes with a hard case, the aux cable is robust, but the sony app is not really usable. Or atleast not as such as the gen2,gen3 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic pair of cans. Very functional. Great sound all the way through the spectrum. The active noise canceling is amazing. Far better than all of the previous cans I have ever tried. The touch controls are hard to use. However, there is a feature that lets you pump ambient noise in to the headphones to let you hear what is going on, its as easy as placing your hand on your right ear! I bought these for air travel, but they have become my everyday headphones. I'll be selling everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Band will snap eventually - get the extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: I used the provided case religiously to store the headset (MDR-1000X). The case requires that you twist the headset a particular way to fit in. After 20 months of moderate use, the headband simply snapped all the way through, without even a sound indicating it broke. I only noticed once I tried to put them back on. It's pretty obvious the twisting motion of the headset causes stress fractures. Hopefully they've resolved in subsequent models. I'd recommend getting the extended warranty. Otherwise, I love them!! Great sound, connectivity, I answer phone calls with them, works great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for 4 months now and they were a great choice. The sound quality is good (not quite as good as other headphones, still VERY good) but the noise cancelling is phenomenal! As someone who travels on planes often, these were the best buy ever. The charge last a long time and they’re light and comfortable. I even wear them when I get migraines to block out the noise. I’m honestly extremely happy with these, even for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great NC. Has trouble blocking voices. Comfortable. Makes CONSTANT quiet static sound when NC is on. Great Sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: -Noise Cancelling: Great at noise cancelling low frequency noises. Like rumbling/air conditioner/Fan/Jet turbines on a plane. Not so good at blocking voices. ------Ordered this product twice, both times the headphones made a constant static sound when noise cancelling was on.----- 7.5/10 -Sound. Great sound quality, good bass, treble and mid. 9/10 -Comfort: 9.5/10 -Price: Is it worth the price? Thats up to you, but in my opinion, not really. 6.5/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great noise cancelling headphones, watched several YouTube videos about various headphones. Went to BB and tried a few on and listened, these sound the best in my opinion. You will find differing thoughts out there but the quality of sound and features available on theses cans are what did it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Best Bluetooth Headphones for Me Yet!! I love these!! I tried the Bose QC35 I did not like them at all? Way to Small Buttons! Tried the Dell One something? They Did not git my Ears! Next tried the New Beats by Dr Dre? Hated them and way to Tight!! Would not keep Tied to My Phone!! These Just Work for Me!!
customer_reviews.author: EBCIII

customer_reviews.title: Hinge Breaks
customer_reviews.text: Some may say sound, noise cancellation, battery life, etc are the most important features of headphones. Sony has heeded that advice and in doing so reminded everyone of a very important lesson --The most important feature of headphones is not falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Baxter Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I got these for $248. They are awesome headphones but they are not loud. I guess that is good for my eardrums but sometimes I feel the urge to bang my head at age 48. Old school heavy metal from the 80's sounds excellent but won't turn up to loud volumes. I think maybe it is my Nexus 6 that is the problem. I might pair these headphones with the new V30 from LG which is supposed to be a sonic powerhouse.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sony Premium Noise Cancelling, Bluetooth Headphone, Black (MDR1000X/B) Very good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. The quality of sound and noise cancelling is very good, and the touch cups are very useful. However plastic is very poor quality and can cracking, so you have to be careful with them, but this is a massive problem, a lots of people are experiencing the same issues. Battery is also good enough.I recommended the Seller as well. Thank You very much.Krzysztof
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof OSAK

customer_reviews.title: From great to trash in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: 5 months after I bought these headphones the plastic above the right ear piece broke. This has happened despite careful use. I have taped the broken parts together, but these headphones are not long for this world. I am very disappointed in Sony for putting an inferior product into the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ink

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware Headband Plastic Breaks with normal use
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for about 18 months and they have never left my living room they are only used when my family is watching something I'm not interested it. The noise cancelling works great! The headband plastic is cheap and broke just above the ear muff. After a little googling this seems to be a common complaint. I would expect a little better quality for headphones that cost over $400.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... noise cancelling headphone I ever owned and it doesn't disappoint me. It feels like you are isolated in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first noise cancelling headphone I ever owned and it doesn't disappoint me. It feels like you are isolated in your own world when you put on this headphone. The noise cancelling is beyond my expectation. I tried it in my house with two kids/TV/X-box gaming/AC/... and I am surprised by its cancelling effect. For the sound quality, I am not a HiFi fan and all I can say is that it is a SONY. How bad can it be?
customer_reviews.author: Bin

customer_reviews.title: Bar none the best noise cancelling headphones on the market
customer_reviews.text: Bar none the best noise cancelling headphones on the market. Great price point. The ability to re-calibrate on the fly as well as auto calibration is awesome. Can pair with multiple devices. The ambient sound mode for inside of airports is amazing. Solid construction, great comfort over the ears, even for those of us with glasses. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: all4jcvette

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancelling, awkward controls
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, however the touch controls are tricky and take some getting used to. I have never used Bose quiet comfort models however I own a decent dac/amp combo and a pair of hd-600s so I feel like I have a decent understanding of what good sound is like. I think these are pretty fair in terms of sound quality, and even better for noise cancelling. If you can deal with the touch controls, these are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use these extensively, nearly every day. The noise cancelling is fantastic - much better than the old noise-cancelling earbuds i had before. It's not perfect, but no solution totally deafens you; this is definitely one of the best out there. The ability to plug in a standard audio cable is extremely nice, and the bluetooth works well.
customer_reviews.author: Knetic

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancellation and pretty good ease of use with ...
customer_reviews.text: Good noise cancellation and pretty good ease of use with the swipe/tap controls on the right ear. Sound quality is solid via BT and being able to use them with a traditional headphone (3.5mm) is great for switching to a laptop or desktop and battery life is excellent - typically lasting for nearly a week of intermittent use (20+ hours of actual use), I don't recommend these for all day use on a long work day but they are light and comfortable for extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones - Poor microphone
customer_reviews.text: These are great, the ambient sound voice mode makes it easier to hear people than if I took the headphones off. I will say that I had to get my headphones replaced due to the microphone being absolutely worthless on phone calls. This second pair works, but everyone thinks I have them on speaker phone. It's acceptable, but it would be nice if they put a little more attention on the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding ear phones.
customer_reviews.text: They'd be great if they could be programed with to work with my wifi. Something is missing or defective when trying to hook them up with my computer's wifi, otherwise they are very good. Followed the instructions but can't get them to play sound using wifi. Even had a computer repair dude help. He couldn't figure it out either. Anyone with a fix, I would appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: D. I. Ronk

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, with a big EXCEPT: the volume does not go very loud. I use them at work and watch various work-related video, and the loudest volume is just barely at a level that I can understand the speaking, but I have to strain. If I play that same video over other headphones or over regular speakers the level is fine, so it's not the video that's the problem.
customer_reviews.author: half5

customer_reviews.title: but these head phones are absolutely fantastic. They sound really great and are very simple ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but these head phones are absolutely fantastic. They sound really great and are very simple to use. I honestly can't say anything bad about them. I use them on my treadmill all the time. They stay on my head even when running. Yes, I sweat a little with them on, but it is so worth it for the quality sound that you get. The sound is rich and clear even on the loudest setting and they are loud with very impressive battery life. You will not regret buying these. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Suebella

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for open space office
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Exceptional sound quality * Good active noise isolation (comparable to Bose, I had Bose QuiteComfort 15) * Good range Cons: * A little tied fit on big head
customer_reviews.author: Viktar Karpach

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap material
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and noise canceling are amazing, however, I started seeing the crack on the twistable area within 3 months. FYI, I do not use my headphones while I workout or any activity that requires me to sweat. After a light use of 1 year and a half year, it broked into 3 pieces. I must say $22/month usage of this headphone was pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Magar, B.

customer_reviews.title: Sony?
customer_reviews.text: I just use them a few days and they broke from the hinges. If you want to contact Sony you have to call! I’m still waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos V.

customer_reviews.title: These work great. Just wish they were not as expensive as ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Just wish they were not as expensive as they are. I would love to use them all over, but I am always afraid I may lose them or they will get stolen. They are a bit bulky, but then I expect that with an over-ear solution and just the look of them. Mine hold a charge for hours and hours. Never had them reach zero yet.
customer_reviews.author: do-not-ask-me

customer_reviews.title: Good noise canceling - Ok sound - A bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Effective noise canceling -Good enough to ride the subway in NYC. Good battery life. Style goes well with business attire. Cons: Kinda heavy - can make ears sweaty. Sound quality isn't super great - especially when listening via Bluetooth. Drains battery on phone when using Bluetooth. Phone calls - ppl had trouble hearing me. The cable detaches easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Five stars all the way! I've used Bose and Beats -- this by far out ranks both in quality and comfort. Also it allows you to control volume, you can turn the music off in one ear if someone is talking to you (just by covering the ear with your hand) and the battery life is awesome! I can go days with out having to charge it. LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Franqui

customer_reviews.title: Best all rounder headphones out there.
customer_reviews.text: It's superb. Sony is always ahead of the game. I use these everyday. You've got the effortless touch controls and nfc pairing, good sound quality and mic which can be used for phone calls, gaming and music creation, along with the noise cancellation. Also allows for auxiliary input for when I really want to push these headphones. Waiting for the next line of these to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: I feel both noise cancelling and sound is better than Bose 35.
customer_reviews.text: I feel both noise cancelling and sound is better than Bose 35. I really like these a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: They break!!!!!! but were replaced by SONY
customer_reviews.text: They seemed to work well. Then the phone broke off on one side. The plastic cracked with little use like a cheap headphone. Earlier SONY headphones were almost indestructible so I was expecting better. Why did SONY fail this time? I clearly see why the one star reviews are there. Then Sony replce my broken headphones with a newer version. Read up it seems that a batch had a weakness and those broke. Lucky I reported before the year was up. Could be four stars if the new ones do not break the band.
customer_reviews.author: NCUser

customer_reviews.title: They Ear phone physically breaks off over time
customer_reviews.text: I paid over $279 for these headphones a couple of years ago. I did so as an investment and planned on using them for years into the future. However, recently the ear parts just snapped off because sony uses cheap plastic instead of extending the steel band. It's totally mind-blowing they would do this on a "premium" product. I say this because headphones under $50 are more durable. It's clearly designed to break after a couple of years so you go out and buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: rocabi llc

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The MDR 1000x's are and amazing pair of wireless noise canceling headphones. They are especially nice for air travel as they block almost all noises. They are comfortable and extremely well built. The beige color looks amazing. Sound quality is great, I just wish they would get a bit louder. Over all an amazing pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Make workplace bearable
customer_reviews.text: Gift for wife - these and her fancy coffee cup are the two things she'd save from a burning building. She doesn't care about sound quality, but appreciates the good battery life, excellent noise cancellation, and phone/mic ability.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like it, an excellent product spec wise, but was very uncomfortable for long duration. Comparison with Bose qc35: + better sound, really pleasing listening to music. - uncomfortable for long duration I think the NC is better on the bose, but the music sounds better on the sony. However the sonys are heavy and really pressed against my jaw and I felt uncomfortable for a 14 hr flight. Tough call if you are making a choice, but I settled with the bose purely from a comfort perspective for long duration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle broken in 12 months by its own. The support  is also very bad, Never recommended
customer_reviews.text: handle broken in 12 months by its own. The support is also very bad, Never recommended for long use. Will never buy Sony headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Guddu

customer_reviews.title: Felt heavy
customer_reviews.text: I will admit we purchased these refurbished and when the arrived they did not work so had to send them back. Perhaps we just got a bad set otherwise the only thing I can say about them is I found them to be a bit heavy on the top of the head.
customer_reviews.author: J. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Now completely cracked and the app
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you do, don’t get these. I bought these despite all the warning about the cracking and I regret it. Mine now has completely cracked despite me being very careful with them. In addition, the app that controls many of the settings is terrible. Just read the reviews in the App Store and see for yourself. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Baron C.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Held up great after 6 months. But for the price if you aren’t in the market for noise cancelling headphones specifically you can get a lot better for the price. However I would recommend them over the Bose QC 35 for sound quality and featured
customer_reviews.author: Gracin S.

customer_reviews.title: I definitely enjoy listening to these more
customer_reviews.text: Top competitor to Bose QC35... These have more features and a bit of a warmer (though flatter sound). Bose have slightly more bass, but sound more synthetic. I definitely enjoy listening to these more. Traveling with the Bose is slightly easier as the case is a bit more compact, but nothing beats the feature of the Sony's to be able to cup your hand over one ear and hear someone talking to you. That alone puts these over the top. These are well made and sound as good as anything in the 300-700 range.
customer_reviews.author: M. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Best sound I've ever heard from headphones. And the charge lasts twenty hours! They are comfortable and the noise cancellation is quite remarkable. I was recently where a large air conditioner was making constant noise. I couldn't hear it at all. And I like how you can tap on the right earphone various ways and use voice activation on your phone, or disable the noise cancellation so you can hear someone speaking.
customer_reviews.author: C.S. Bills

customer_reviews.title: Get the new model instead.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is amazing. Just be careful when collapsing it and putting it in the case or taking it out because the plastic material on the headband is not very strong. Also, the ear pads are a little bit bulky. Beware that sony's music app doesn't support this model so I'd recommend you get the newest version (WH1000XM2).
customer_reviews.author: Richie Rich

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last!
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like the Sony MDX1000’s sound signature, the build quality is bad, as noted by others. The infamous crack above one earpiece appeared within 3 months, by now the headphones have fallen apart altogether. They were MUCH too expensive to last under a year — but of course they’re “last year’s model” and the company has moved on. Not “premium” at all, except for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Gerber

customer_reviews.title: would have been nice if Amazon had a bit of flexibility in the ...
customer_reviews.text: headphones totally quit working 4 days after the 30 day return period. now I am stuck with headphones that don't work at all and Sony is dragging their feet about replacing. would have been nice if Amazon had a bit of flexibility in the return window timeframe.
customer_reviews.author: gabnj

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great no-sound and pretty comfortable too!
customer_reviews.text: So far great, the sound is pretty good, the noise cancellation works pretty well, no connection dropouts, easy to pair. The sound is a bit "rounded", not sure how to describe it, I guess the highs are very slightly less pronounced than I would expect? They do sound amazing overall though.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Steffl

customer_reviews.title: only got 1 year of very light use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones served me well for about one year. The sound quality, etc. is really good. Always kept them in their case, very gentle use, etc. perhaps 1 hour of usage per week. Left side started having connection/conductivity issues as if the cables inside are damaged. For the price and light use, I'd expected a few years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: PinkPanter

customer_reviews.title: the Sony have a better sound quality and better noice cancelation
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of the Bose QC35, the Sony have a better sound quality and better noice cancelation. Regarding the durability, so far (8 months) it still goes strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shai

customer_reviews.title: Life savers
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase of the year. These make it possible to listen to classical music and preserve the dynamic range and not hear the talking, clanging, crunching, whatever noise people are making around you. The sound is excellent and the battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Just do it
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed. It has a ton of features that I was not aware of. I bought because of all the great reviews and figured that if they were not 'magnificent' that I would simply return due to their high price point. You won't be disappointed. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: javi

customer_reviews.title: Better than BOSE 35's
customer_reviews.text: I like the soundstage on the Sony better than my BOSE. Sony has better bass and mids. Noise cancellation is a push between the two. The Sony cans fit my big head better. Slight edge to Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: holy guacamole!
customer_reviews.text: Best NC headphones ever..period! Beats QC-35 for miles! I'm a Bose fan, but i must tip my hat off with Sony! Great product! I was hesitating if giving it a try and then return it, oh boy! im glad i did buy it...not returning it though! If you are a Bose-man don't worry, you will love this! construction materials, functionality, battery life!!!! all excellent! Kudos Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Tito Morales

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good, but not great for the price. My main problem is that it's uncomfortable; I cannot keep wearing more than an hour. It practically hurts my ears. It gets sweaty quickly too. Noise cancelling is excellent. It has convenient features as well. However, it does not pair easily and connects to only one device at a time. I sometimes have to check on my notebook, Ipad, etc. to make sure they are disconnected in order to connect with my phone for example. It also does not remember a device so that there is no automatic connection. For this price, the product is a failure for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Really bad materials
customer_reviews.text: Both Headbands snapped a couple of months in, had to tape it together. Looks really horrible now but otherwise great. Honestly were it $100 headphones would not have minded it so much for +$300 this was really bad, never going to buy their headphones again.
customer_reviews.author: Kaustubh

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but get uncomfortable after a while
customer_reviews.text: Great noise canceling. Great sound quality. Great battery life. Great headphones in every aspect....except... if you have them on for long periods of time, you'll want to take a break as they get a bit uncomfortable. Not unbearable but enough that you'll notice. Perhaps mine will break in more after some time. Bose are more comfortable, but Sony is better quality tech.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good ANC poor everything else.
customer_reviews.text: Nice features and really good ANC. Sound quality is very underwhelming - very soft with no emotion. They are not comfortable; the ear muffs are too small with very little padding and there is bad noise bleed. The headband has cheap padding as well and I question the durability. The travel case is OK, cannot fit cables inside and again, I question the durability here as well. Sound: the sound quality is not horrible, however, lacks any sound stage - not better than a $50 pair of headphone. The other benefits are not so impressive that I would forgo a good sounding pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling and quality of sound aspects are commendable. However, there is not enough foam support on the top piece to feel comfortable, the ear pieces are super thick (as in, they stick out really far from your head, the opposite of 'sleek'), and my ears heat up pretty quickly. Also, it is not possible to wear these with glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Happy and nervous.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when it was on sale for $230 and just got it recently. Very pleased with the headphone's noise cancellation feature and the audio. My favorite is probably the controls which personally makes it better than the Bose's QC35. I am just praying that it won't crack like the others.
customer_reviews.author: rawr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphone. Sound is better than my Bose QC15 and the noise cancelling is almost perfect. I love the feature that allows you to hear the "outside world" by taping the earphone on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme S.

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: I got these today I have to say their great! I spent all day listening. The features took s sec to figure out. But they really make it convenient to interact with the world while still emmersed in the music. And they really look and feel high quality. They better be for 400$. No buyers remorse here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the QCs
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Love. If you read my other reviews, you see that I rarely experience love. Never hugged as a child or something. The noise cancelling is phenomenal, but so is the bluetooth implementation / multiple device support, gestures, and quality of phone calls. They also look brilliant. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES L

customer_reviews.title: Only way to fly
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable with amazing noise cancellation. Battery seems to go forever. Great features like tap and hold right ear to open Mic to hear what's going on around you. I can't tell you how many times this comes in handy on a flight when you are talking with Flight attendant.
customer_reviews.author: DPBFREE75

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I’ve ever had. Better sound quality and BASS than Bose. Comfy and foldable with case good to go where ever. With the noise cancelling you hear nothing but what is coming thru the headphones. Awesome. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: deana

product_meta.title: Sony Premium Noise Cancelling, Bluetooth Headphone, Grey Beige (MDR1000X/C) (2016 model)
product_meta.description: Color:GrayNever miss a beat with smart, adaptive noise cancelling, wireless freedom and Hi-Res audio that lets you focus on music in its purest form. Cord Length: Headphone cable (approx. 4.92', silver-coated OFC strands, gold-plated stereo mini plug); Frequency Response: 4 Hz-40,000 Hz; Cord Type: Single-sided (detachable); Volume Sensor: Touch sensor
feature_bullets: Isolate yourself from external noise with industry-leading noise cancelation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,000 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
